subject: Productivity
title: The Two Minute Rule
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Two Minute Rule.

hook.text: James Clear says any new habit should take less than two minutes to start.

buildup.text: Want to read more? The habit isn't reading a chapter. It's opening the book and reading one page.

discovery.text: The rule targets the entry point. Once you begin, continuing feels natural and effortless.

twist.text: People overdesign habits. Running five miles sounds heroic but never starts. Two minutes always does.

climax.text: Master the art of showing up first. Optimize the habit later, after it's locked into place.

punchline.text: A habit must be easy to start to last.

quiz.question: What does the two-minute rule target?
options: The entry point of a new habit
The total duration of a habit
The reward at the end of a habit
